quality.title: Quality
quality.p1: We are 'qualiteers' from the bottom of our hearts.
quality.p2: Basis of our Quality Management System (QMS) are international standards such as ISO 9001 as well as customer, legal and other requirements.
quality.p3: By establishing a QMS right from the very beginning we aim to ensure compliance with and correct implementation of all quality management requirements.
quality.p4: We continuously develop our competencies to be able to offer best-of-class quality to our customers and to meet or  rather exceed their expectations.
quality.p5: EVO's top management is  commited in running, maintaining and continuously improving our QMS, and we will ensure that this policy is communicated and performed within all levels of EVO staff.

infosec.title: Information Security
infosec.p1: Our business activities depend more and more on information and communication technologies (ICT). Every day, we exchange information both internally and externally, whether with customers, employees, suppliers or other stakeholders.
infosec.p2: Protecting this information in terms of confidentiality, availability and integrity is a top priority for us. When setting up and operating our infrastructure, IT landscape and training our employees, we are guided by the requirements of established standards such as ISO 27001 or VDA-ISA (TISAX).

compliance.metaTitle: Compliance & Code of Ethics | EVO Engineering GmbH
compliance.metaDescription: It is fundamental to the success of our company that we make well-grounded decisions at all times as business partners, suppliers, customers, and an employer.
compliance.title: Compliance & Code of Ethics
compliance.description: Compliance is not an empty phrase for us, it is a self-evident obligation, every day.

content.p1: Compliance is not an empty phrase for us, it is a self-evident obligation, every day.
content.p2: It is fundamental to the success of our company that we make well-grounded decisions at all times as business partners, suppliers, customers, and an employer. One basis for these decisions are
content.l1:
• Applicable laws
  • The ten principles of the United Nations Global Compact on human rights, labor, environmental responsibility and anti-corruption, and
  • Our corporate values
content.p3: All employees of EVO Engineering GmbH are obliged to comply with these rules.
content.p4: Our employees' well-being is very important to us. They shall all have proper working conditions for their health and safety. We all deserve mutual respect.
content.p5: EVO wants to provide jobs, that are free of discrimination and harassment based on gender, race, skin color, religion, age, nationality, disabilities, or sexual orientation. Neither bullying nor discrimination is tolerated.
content.p6: Conflicts of interest shall be avoided, e.g by not hiring close relatives as direct subordinates. In case a potential conflict of interest is noticed, it is expected to be reported proactively, and each case is assessed case by case.
content.p7: We do not tolerate corruption or bribery of any kind. It is prohibited to give or accept, any gifts or respective, which could impair the objective business decision making
content.p8: Knowledge and information is our biggest asset, so we protect them as well as possible.
content.p9: We never disclose any business secrets to anyone who is not entitled to that information.
content.p10: Any business information, whether it is digital, physical, or spoken, is handled with care. All EVO employees adhere to strict guidelines, e.g. clear/clean desk/screen policy and information handling policy.
content.p11: In case we get to know insider information, we use it only in a manner allowed by applicable laws.
content.p12: We apply the specifications of EU-GDPR and local laws.
content.p13: We expect corresponding policies and behavior from our partners, suppliers, and customers. Awareness and open communication are very important to us. So everybody is obliged to speak up if any violation of laws or this code of conduct is perceived and contact one's manager. We will protect whistle-blowers in accordance with applicable law.

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.p1: Compliance with data protection laws is not only a legal obligation for EVO Engineering GmbH, but also an important factor of trust. With the following data protection regulations, we would therefore like to inform you transparently about the type, scope and purpose of the personal data collected from you and processed within this website, as well as your rights. Personal data in this case is all information with which you can be personally identified.
privacy.p2: As the operator of the website www.evo-e.com, EVO Engineering GmbH (hereinafter referred to as 'We') is the responsible party pursuant to Article 4 No. 7 of the EU General Data Protection Regulation (DSGVO). If you have any questions, you can contact info@evo-e.com.
privacy.p3: The data processing is carried out by EVO Engineering GmbH, Frankfurter Ring 105, 80807 Munich, Germany. Further contact details and company information can be found in the imprint of this website or in the privacy policy below.
privacy.p4:
As a data subject, you have the following rights with respect to us regarding your personal data. You have: 

  • - A right to information about, among other things, the categories of data processed, the processing purposes, the storage period, and any recipients, in accordance with Article 15 DSGVO and Section 34 BDSG. 
  • - A right to correction or deletion of incorrect or incomplete data, pursuant to Art. 16 and 17 DSGVO and § 35 BDSG. 
  • - A right to restriction of processing under the conditions of Art. 18 DSGVO or § 35 para. 1 p. 2 BDSG. 
  • - A right to object to the processing pursuant to Art. 21 (1) DSGVO, insofar as the data processing was based on legitimate interest. 
  • - A right to revoke a given consent with effect for the future pursuant to Art. 7 (3) DSGVO. 
  • - A right to data portability in a common format pursuant to Art. 20 GDPR. 
  • - You have a right under Article 22 of the GDPR not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing that produces legal effects concerning you or similarly significantly affects you. This also includes profiling within the meaning of Art. 4 No. 4 DSGVO. 

- You also have the right to lodge a complaint about the processing of your personal data by us with a data protection supervisory authority in accordance with Art. 77 DSGVO, in particular in the Member State of your habitual residence, your place of work, or the place of the alleged infringement.
privacy.p5:
If you assert your rights under the GDPR and the BDSG against us, we will process the data you provide to us in the process in order to fulfill your claim. 

Subsequently, we will store the data transmitted by you to us and the data transmitted by us to you in return for the purpose of documentation until the expiry of the statute of limitations under regulatory law (3 years). 

The legal basis for the processing and storage of the data is Art. 6 para. 1 p. 1 letter f) DSGVO (legitimate interest in data processing). The legitimate interest arises from our obligation to comply with your request and the need to be able to exonerate ourselves in possible fine proceedings by proving that we have properly complied with your request. 

You can object to the processing of your data on the basis of our legitimate interest at any time under the conditions of Art. 21 DSGVO. To do so, please use the contact details provided in the imprint. However, we would like to point out that the processing of your data to prove compliance with the data subject rights is mandatory within the meaning of Art. 21 (1) DSGVO, as other means of proof do not exist or are not equally suitable.
